--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Mark Levison" <mlevison@...> wrote:
>
> At l=
ong last I'm giving a tutorial on test driven development on
> Wednesday an=
d am looking for some interesting examples to demo test
> driven developmen=
t. In 10-15 minutes what do you try and build? Any
> reason you choose it? =
Anything in particular you try to demonstrate?

Given the time you have, I =
have found that something like a static
method that calculates factorial (o=
r Fibonacci) is a great example. 
Everyone knows (or should know) what the =
method is supposed to do,
they can be implemented in different ways (e.g. l=
oop or recursion) and
have some interesting corner cases (e.g. factorial(N)=
 can be equal to
zero for large values of N if you use plain ol' ints.)

Ke=
nt Beck and I recorded a quick demo using TDD to implement
factorial.  We a=
lso use JUnit Factory, but the bulk of the demo is
about TDD. You can find =
it at:

http://www.agitar.com/developers/junit_factory.html

Click on "Albe=
rto Savoia and Kent Beck demonstrate JUnitFactory".

Alberto Savoia
